content.description: Climb from the white finger ledges straight up. Finishes at the top of Standard route.
content.protection: Two anchor bolts with quick links at the top.
content.location: Start 10 ft to the left of the Standard Route crack at a series of eye-level 2" ledges in a white section of the rock, just to the left of a yellowish section.

content.description: This is the area of easy climbs to the left of the Standard Crack Route (and to the right of where the trail goes onto the slab)

Follow the obvious ramp from the ground up to the right. Keep drifting rightwards until you are under the rope just below the final bulge (5.3-5.4 to this point). Getting over the top is the crux (reachy).
content.protection: There is a two bolt anchor at the top.
content.location: Drop a rope from the 3rd set of bolts to the left of Standard route when viewed from the ground. Begin ~15 ft to the left of the rope line. Start at the clump of roots jutting out at the base of the cliff.

content.description: Boulder through the bulges, then move left to the last bolt of Great White. Finish at the anchors of that route.
content.location: Start to the right of Great White

content.description: This the first, very obvious hand crack on the left hand side of the cliff.
content.protection: Standard Rack. Can be top roped via a two bolt anchor on top. Be careful scrambling around up top. There is a quick link attached to each bolt hangar for convenience. There is also another bolt about ten feet above the anchor bolts.
content.location: The first crack as you approach the left hand side of the cliff.

content.description: Start on the Mako Roof, but after clipping the natural thread and first bolt go directly out the horizontal roof to a lip encounter boulder problem crux.
content.location: Centerline on the cliff with the best rock.

content.description: Mako roof makes its way up though some steep blocky features before making a throw for a horizontal beneath a large roof.  A very pumpy hand traverse leads to a somewhat desperate clip and a V3+ boulder problem to establish on the large flake.  Clip the 3rd bolt and go up about 6-10 feet of much lower angle rock and clip the anchor.  An extension could easily be added to this route as the steep slab continues up another 20 meters of so.  While there aren't any showstopper moves on this, the boulder problem is pretty powerful and it comes right at the end of a very pumpy traverse and the long throw to the horizontal.  If you have the traverse and clip dialed this may feel soft in the grade, but the onsight may feel stiff.  The rock quality is superb with good friction but not sharp.
content.protection: Thread followed by 3 bolts.  Only 1 bolt anchor!!
content.location: Left most route that starts under the large roofs on the right side of the South Face

content.description: Meander up the rope line to the crux, going over the bulge (reachy).
content.protection: There is a two bolt anchor at the top.
content.location: Drop a rope from the 3rd set of bolts to the left of Standard route when viewed from the ground. Begin directly under the rope.

content.description: The obvious line of big horizontals under the right side of the roof capping the southern face's right end. Be prepared to go big!
content.protection: 3 bolts. Guidebook lists optional cams for the horizontals
content.location: Southern face of Jockey Cap, far right side

content.description: Start just to the right of Mako Roof, climb straight up through the roofs to an anchor. 4 bolts
content.location: Right side of the south face.

content.description: Follow the rope line up to an interesting move at a left-slanting crack. Move slightly right on the face to get over the bulge.
content.protection: There is a two bolt anchor at the top.
content.location: Drop a rope from the 1st set of bolts to the left of Standard route when viewed from the ground.

content.description:
This is the climb that starts at the very "toe" of the cliff.  #2 of the sketch/topo 

  P1 - Scramble up to an arete and crack, climb through this and exit right. Protect for the followers, and then continue on the very easy slab to the double bolt anchor of "Peary Gates"  120 ft 5.5 - 5.6
Climb the obvious line just to the right of the rope. Nice 5.4-5.5 climbing to the crux at the final bulge (reachy).
content.protection: There is a two bolt anchor at the top.
content.location: Drop a rope from the 3rd set of bolts to the left of Standard route when viewed from the ground. Begin ~6 ft to the right of the rope line.

content.description:
These are the climbs # 3 and #4 on the sketch topo.  

  Approach from the top on the low angle slab. Locate the rap anchor and rap down to the lower Rap anchor 40-45 ft below.  

  Lead or Top Rope the two climbs.  The climb on the left is a bit more difficult (5.8- ?) than the one on the right (5.7)

These are the two climbs # 5 and #6 on the sketch/topo. 

  Locate the anchors on the low-angle slab and rap 30 feet to the lower anchor. Lead or top rope the climbs.  Both are about 5.6-5.7
